commander.flavorText: "I'll have my revenge if I have to call on every force from above and below."
commander.name: Kaalia of the Vast
commander.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Kaalia of the Vast attacks an opponent, you may put an Angel, Demon, or Dragon creature card from your hand onto the battlefield tapped and attacking that opponent.

rulings.text: Although the creature you put onto the battlefield is an attacking creature, it was never declared as an attacking creature. This means that abilities that trigger whenever a creature attacks won't trigger when it enters the battlefield attacking.

Any effects that say that the Angel, Demon, or Dragon creature can't attack (such as that of Propaganda or if the creature has defender) affect only the declaration of attackers. They won't stop the creature from entering the battlefield attacking.
If Kaalia attacks an opponent, the creature enters attacking that player even if Kaalia is somehow attacking a different player or planeswalker as its triggered ability resolves.

If the opponent Kaalia attacked is no longer in the game when its ability resolves, you may put an Angel, Demon, or Dragon creature card onto the battlefield tapped, but it won't be attacking anyone and it won't be an attacking creature.
Kaalia's ability doesn't trigger if it attacks a planeswalker or battle.

commander.text:
Flying
Whenever Kaalia of the Vast attacks an opponent, you may put an Angel, Demon, or Dragon creature card from your hand onto the battlefield tapped and attacking that opponent.

mainBoard.name: Akroma, Angel of Fury
mainBoard.originalText:
Akroma, Angel of Fury can't be countered.
Flying, trample, protection from white and from blue
{R}: Akroma, Angel of Fury gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Morph {3}{R}{R}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

rulings.text: A spell or ability that counters spells can still target Akroma. When that spell or ability resolves, Akroma won't be countered, but any additional effects of the countering spell or ability will still happen.
If Akroma, Angel of Fury is cast face down, it can be countered.

In a Commander game where Akroma is your commander, you may cast it face down from the command zone by paying {3} plus {2} for each time it has been cast from your command zone. The cost to turn it face up is unaffected. While face down, the combat damage it deals is still counted as damage dealt by your commander.

mainBoard.text:
This spell can't be countered.
Flying, trample, protection from white and from blue
{R}: Akroma, Angel of Fury gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Morph {3}{R}{R}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

mainBoard.flavorText:
"I feel in them a sense of duty and commitment, yet I can feel nothing else. It is as if their duty is to an empty void."
—Razia, Boros archangel
mainBoard.name: Angel of Despair
mainBoard.originalText:
Flying
When Angel of Despair enters the battlefield, destroy target permanent.
mainBoard.text:
Flying
When Angel of Despair enters, destroy target permanent.

mainBoard.name: Angelic Arbiter
mainBoard.originalText:
Flying
Each opponent who cast a spell this turn can't attack with creatures.
Each opponent who attacked with a creature this turn can't cast spells.

rulings.text: Angelic Arbiter's last ability applies if an opponent attacked with at least one creature during the current turn.

During an opponent's turn, that opponent may either cast spells or attack with creatures, but not both (assuming that Angelic Arbiter is on the battlefield for the entirety of that turn). The player may perform other actions, such as activating abilities and playing lands.
During your turn, Angelic Arbiter's abilities have no effect on the game.

If Angelic Arbiter enters during an opponent's turn, its abilities take actions that player performed earlier in the turn into account, even though it wasn't on the battlefield at the time. For example, if an opponent casts a spell, then you use Leyline of Anticipation's ability to cast Angelic Arbiter as though it had flash, that player won't be able to attack with creatures that turn.

If Angelic Arbiter leaves the battlefield during an opponent's turn, its abilities cease to affect the game. For example, if an opponent casts Doom Blade to destroy Angelic Arbiter, that player may then attack with creatures.

mainBoard.text:
Flying
Each opponent who cast a spell this turn can't attack with creatures.
Each opponent who attacked with a creature this turn can't cast spells.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"For its time as a mortal, Anger chose a shell of boiling rock."
—*Scroll of Beginnings*
mainBoard.name: Anger
mainBoard.originalText:
Haste
As long as Anger is in your graveyard and you control a Mountain, creatures you control have haste.

rulings.text: The timestamp for the "in your graveyard" ability is set at the time that this card goes to your graveyard, regardless of whether you control a Mountain at that time.

mainBoard.text:
Haste
As long as Anger is in your graveyard and you control a Mountain, creatures you control have haste.

mainBoard.name: Archangel of Strife
mainBoard.originalText:
Flying
As Archangel of Strife enters the battlefield, each player chooses war or peace.
Creatures controlled by players who chose war get +3/+0.
Creatures controlled by players who chose peace get +0/+3.

rulings.text: Archangel of Strife's bonuses apply immediately. Depending on your choice, Archangel of Strife will enter as either a 9/6 or 6/9 creature.

Archangel of Strife's second and third abilities are linked. Similarly, its second and fourth abilities are linked. The bonus a player's creatures get depends only on the choice that player made when Archangel of Strife entered.
As soon as Archangel of Strife leaves the battlefield, the bonus stops applying. If it returns to the battlefield, players will be able to make new choices.
If there are two Archangels of Strife on the battlefield, and you choose war for one and peace for the other, your creatures get +3/+3.
The active player chooses war or peace first, followed by each other player in turn order. Each player will know what previous players chose when making their choice.

mainBoard.text:
Flying
As Archangel of Strife enters, each player chooses war or peace.
Creatures controlled by players who chose war get +3/+0.
Creatures controlled by players who chose peace get +0/+3.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Diplomacy has solved nothing. Only bloodspill can end this now. Call forth the warbringer."
—Basandra, Battle Seraph
mainBoard.name: Avatar of Slaughter
mainBoard.originalText: All creatures have double strike and attack each turn if able.

rulings.text: If, during a player's declare attackers step, a creature is tapped, is affected by a spell or ability that says it can't attack, or hasn't been under that player's control continuously since the turn began (and doesn't have haste), then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having a creature attack, the player isn't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack in that case either.

mainBoard.text: All creatures have double strike and attack each combat if able.

mainBoard.flavorText: "Why listen to the mumblings of wizards when the lash speaks true?"
mainBoard.name: Basandra, Battle Seraph
mainBoard.originalText:
Flying
Players can't cast spells during combat.
{R}: Target creature attacks this turn if able.

rulings.text: If, during a player’s declare attackers step, a creature is tapped, is affected by a spell or ability that says it can’t attack, or hasn’t been under that player’s control continuously since the turn began (and doesn’t have haste), then it doesn’t attack. If there’s a cost associated with having a creature attack, the player isn’t forced to pay that cost, so it doesn’t have to attack in that case either.
Players may still activate abilities during combat.
While Basandra, Battle Seraph is on the battlefield, players can’t cast any spells during the combat phase, including permanent spells with flash.

mainBoard.text:
Flying
Players can't cast spells during combat.
{R}: Target creature attacks this turn if able.

mainBoard.name: Dragon Whelp
mainBoard.originalText:
Flying
{R}: Dragon Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Dragon Whelp at the beginning of the next end step.

rulings.text: If the fourth (or more) time Dragon Whelp’s ability is activated during the same turn happens to be during that turn’s end step, the delayed triggered ability won’t trigger until the beginning of the next turn’s end step. You’ll have to sacrifice Dragon Whelp at that time.

The first three times Dragon Whelp’s ability is activated in a turn will do nothing other than give it +1/+0 until end of turn. Any subsequent activations will also cause its delayed triggered ability to trigger. That means if you activate Dragon Whelp’s ability five times, for example, two different delayed triggered abilities will trigger at the beginning of the next end step and cause you to sacrifice Dragon Whelp.

If the fourth (or subsequent) time Dragon Whelp’s ability is activated during the same turn is during that turn’s end step, the delayed triggered ability won’t trigger until the beginning of the next turn’s end step. You’ll have to sacrifice Dragon Whelp at that time.

There’s no limit to the number of times you can activate Dragon Whelp’s ability in a turn. However, the fourth activation in a turn and each subsequent activation will cause a delayed triggered ability that will force you to sacrifice Dragon Whelp at the beginning of the next end step.

mainBoard.text:
Flying
{R}: Dragon Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Dragon Whelp at the beginning of the next end step.

mainBoard.flavorText: Those who hear its roar perish. The lucky ones only feel its fetid breath.
mainBoard.name: Dread Cacodemon
mainBoard.originalText: When Dread Cacodemon enters the battlefield, if you cast it from your hand, destroy all creatures your opponents control, then tap all other creatures you control.

rulings.text: If you put Dread Cacodemon directly onto the battlefield from your hand, perhaps because of Kaalia of the Vast’s ability, its ability won’t trigger.
If a creature (such as Clone) enters the battlefield as a copy of this creature, the copy’s “enters-the-battlefield” ability will still trigger as long as you cast that creature spell from your hand.

mainBoard.text: When Dread Cacodemon enters, if you cast it from your hand, destroy all creatures your opponents control, then tap all other creatures you control.

mainBoard.name: Duergar Hedge-Mage
mainBoard.originalText:
When Duergar Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Mountains, you may destroy target artifact.
When Duergar Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Plains, you may destroy target enchantment.

rulings.text: Both abilities are optional; you choose whether to use them when they resolve. If an ability has a target, you must choose a target even if you don't plan to use the ability.
Both abilities trigger at the same time. You can put them on the stack in any order.

Each of the triggered abilities has an "intervening 'if' clause." That means (1) the ability won't trigger at all unless you control two or more lands of the appropriate land type when the Hedge-Mage enters, and (2) the ability will do nothing if you don't control two or more lands of the appropriate land type by the time it resolves.
Each of the triggered abilities look at your lands individually. This means that if you only control two dual-lands of the appropriate types, both of the abilities will trigger.

mainBoard.text:
When Duergar Hedge-Mage enters, if you control two or more Mountains, you may destroy target artifact.
When Duergar Hedge-Mage enters, if you control two or more Plains, you may destroy target enchantment.

mainBoard.name: Malfegor
mainBoard.originalText:
Flying
When Malfegor enters the battlefield, discard your hand. Each opponent sacrifices a creature for each card discarded this way.

rulings.text: After you discard your hand and the number of creatures each opponent must sacrifice has been determined, each opponent in turn order, starting with the player whose turn it is if that player is your opponent, chooses which creatures they will sacrifice, then all the chosen creatures are all sacrificed at the same time.
Malfegor’s ability is not optional. You must discard your entire hand no matter how many creatures your opponents control.

Flying, vigilance

rulings.text: The creature card is chosen at random from among creature cards in the target opponent's graveyard as the ability resolves. Players can respond to the ability knowing the targeted player, but they won't know which creature card is about to enter.
The only target of this ability is the opponent.

mainBoard.originalText:
Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and enchantments.
Cycling {3} ({3}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

mainBoard.text:
Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and enchantments.

mainBoard.flavorText: Suddenly, Eldo felt very alone.

mainBoard.originalText: Each player other than target player creates a 5/5 red Dragon creature token with flying.

rulings.text: If Death by Dragons resolves, the player who’s targeted is the only one who won’t put a Dragon token onto the battlefield.
If the player is an illegal target when Death by Dragons tries to resolve, it won’t resolve and none of its effects will happen. No player will put a Dragon token onto the battlefield.

mainBoard.text: Each player other than target player creates a 5/5 red Dragon creature token with flying.

mainBoard.flavorText: The wise always keep an ear open to the whispers of power.

mainBoard.originalText: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature is without flying is only checked on resolution.

mainBoard.text: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.

mainBoard.originalText: Each other player sacrifices a creature. You create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token for each creature sacrificed this way.
mainBoard.text: Each other player sacrifices a creature. You create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token for each creature sacrificed this way.

mainBoard.flavorText: When tempers run high, it's easy to lose your head.
mainBoard.name: Syphon Mind
mainBoard.originalText: Each other player discards a card. You draw a card for each card discarded this way.
mainBoard.text: Each other player discards a card. You draw a card for each card discarded this way.

mainBoard.flavorText: "Truth shines even in darkness. Those who march on the side of truth walk always in righteous light."
mainBoard.name: Bathe in Light
mainBoard.originalText: Radiance — Choose a color. Target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it gain protection from the chosen color until end of turn.

rulings.text: A creature “shares a color” with any creature that is at least one of its colors. For example, a green-white creature shares a color with creatures that are green, white, green-white, red-white, black-green, and so on.
All creatures that share a color are affected, even your own.
If it targets a colorless creature, it doesn’t affect any other creatures. A colorless creature shares a color with nothing, not even other colorless creatures.
Only one creature is targeted. If that creature leaves the battlefield or otherwise becomes an illegal target, the entire spell doesn’t resolve. No other creatures are affected.
The color you choose as the spell resolves has nothing to do with the color or colors shared by the affected creatures.
You check which creatures share a color with the target when the spell resolves.

mainBoard.text: Radiance — Choose a color. Target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it gain protection from the chosen color until end of turn.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Justice is toothless without punishment. Righteousness cannot succeed without the suffering of the guilty."
—Razia, Boros archangel
mainBoard.name: Cleansing Beam
mainBoard.originalText: Radiance — Cleansing Beam deals 2 damage to target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it.

rulings.text: A creature “shares a color” with any creature that is at least one of its colors. For example, a green-white creature shares a color with creatures that are green, white, green-white, red-white, black-green, and so on.
All creatures that share a color are affected, even your own.
If it targets a colorless creature, it doesn’t affect any other creatures. A colorless creature shares a color with nothing, not even other colorless creatures.
Only one creature is targeted. If that creature leaves the battlefield or otherwise becomes an illegal target, the entire spell doesn’t resolve. No other creatures are affected.
You check which creatures share a color with the target when the spell resolves.

mainBoard.text: Radiance — Cleansing Beam deals 2 damage to target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it.

mainBoard.name: Comet Storm
mainBoard.originalText:
Multikicker {1} (You may pay an additional {1} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
Choose target creature or player, then choose another target creature or player for each time Comet Storm was kicked. Comet Storm deals X damage to each of them.

rulings.text: As long as any of its targets are legal at the time Comet Storm resolves, Comet Storm will deal X damage to each of those legal targets.
Each target you choose must be different.

For example, if you want Comet Storm to deal 4 damage to each of three different targets, that means X is 4 and you're kicking the spell twice. You'll pay a mana cost of {4}{R}{R}, plus a kicker cost of {1}, plus another kicker cost of {1}, for a total of {6}{R}{R}.

The number of targets you choose for Comet Storm is one more than the number of times it's kicked. First you declare how many times you're going to kick the spell (at the same time you declare the value of X), then you choose the targets accordingly, then you pay the costs. No player can respond between the time you declare how many times you'll kick the spell and the time you choose the targets.

mainBoard.text:
Multikicker {1} (You may pay an additional {1} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
Choose any target, then choose another target for each time this spell was kicked. Comet Storm deals X damage to each of them.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"In the gathering there is strength for all who founder, renewal for all who languish, love for all who sing."
—*Song of All*, canto 642
mainBoard.name: Congregate
mainBoard.originalText: Target player gains 2 life for each creature on the battlefield.

rulings.text: Count the number of creatures as Congregate resolves to determine how much life is gained.

mainBoard.text: Target player gains 2 life for each creature on the battlefield.

mainBoard.name: Master Warcraft
mainBoard.originalText:
Cast Master Warcraft only before attackers are declared.
You choose which creatures attack this turn.
You choose which creatures block this turn and how those creatures block.

rulings.text: You choose attackers and make blocking assignments regardless of whether it's your turn and regardless of whether the creatures are attacking you. Your choices must be legal within the normal rules for attacking and blocking.
You can decide that a creature won't block.

If the defending player controls a planeswalker, the person who cast Master Warcraft first chooses the complete group of creatures that are going to attack. Then, for each of those creatures, the active player chooses who or what it's going to attack.
If a turn has multiple combat phases, this spell can only be cast before the beginning of the Declare Attackers Step of the first combat phase in that turn.

mainBoard.text:
Cast this spell only before attackers are declared.
You choose which creatures attack this turn.
You choose which creatures block this turn and how those creatures block.

mainBoard.flavorText: The eyes let flow with tears, then blood, then the very soul—the whole wrung inside out, dripping down into the blackened puddle of the past.
mainBoard.name: Mortify
mainBoard.originalText: Destroy target creature or enchantment.

rulings.text: This spell isn't Modal. When it resolves, it will destroy the target if it's a creature or an enchantment, even if it changed from one to the other between targeting and resolution.

mainBoard.text: Destroy target creature or enchantment.

mainBoard.name: Orim's Thunder
mainBoard.originalText:
Kicker {R} (You may pay an additional {R} as you cast this spell.)
Destroy target artifact or enchantment. If Orim's Thunder was kicked, it deals damage equal to that permanent's converted mana cost to target creature.

rulings.text: If Orim's Thunder is kicked, but the artifact or enchantment is an illegal target as Orim's Thunder tries to resolve, Orim's Thunder won't be able to determine the artifact or enchantment's mana value. No damage will be dealt to the target creature, even if it remained a legal target. If only the creature has become an illegal target, the artifact or enchantment will still be destroyed. (If both targets become illegal, Orim's Thunder won't resolve at all.)
If Orim's Thunder is kicked, it's the source of damage dealt to the target creature, not the artifact or enchantment.

mainBoard.text:
Kicker {R} (You may pay an additional {R} as you cast this spell.)
Destroy target artifact or enchantment. If this spell was kicked, it deals damage equal to that permanent's mana value to target creature.

mainBoard.name: Path to Exile
mainBoard.originalText: Exile target creature. Its controller may search his or her library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle his or her library.

rulings.text: If the target creature is an illegal target by the time Path to Exile tries to resolve, the spell won't resolve. The creature's controller won't search for a basic land card.
The controller of the exiled creature isn't required to search their library for a basic land. If that player doesn't, the player won't shuffle their library.

mainBoard.text: Exile target creature. Its controller may search their library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.

mainBoard.flavorText: Some timelines forever fray, branch, and intermingle. Others end abruptly.
mainBoard.name: Return to Dust
mainBoard.originalText: Exile target artifact or enchantment. If you cast this spell during your main phase, you may exile up to one other target artifact or enchantment.

rulings.text: If a spell or ability copies Return to Dust, the copy exiles only the first target artifact or enchantment. This is because the copy wasn't cast at all.
Return to Dust can always target a second artifact or enchantment; it just won't exile it if it's not your main phase when you cast Return to Dust.

mainBoard.text: Exile target artifact or enchantment. If you cast this spell during your main phase, you may exile up to one other target artifact or enchantment.

mainBoard.flavorText: The Keldons used the toxic vents in the cracked earth to bolster their home's defenses.
mainBoard.name: Sulfurous Blast
mainBoard.originalText: Sulfurous Blast deals 2 damage to each creature and each player. If you cast this spell during your main phase, Sulfurous Blast deals 3 damage to each creature and each player instead.
mainBoard.text: Sulfurous Blast deals 2 damage to each creature and each player. If you cast this spell during your main phase, Sulfurous Blast deals 3 damage to each creature and each player instead.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"I've seen death before. My mother succumbing to illness, my comrades bleeding on the battlefield . . . But I'd never seen anything as dreadful as that."
—Taani, berserker of Etlan
mainBoard.name: Terminate
mainBoard.originalText: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.
mainBoard.text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.

mainBoard.flavorText: Rakdos festivals almost leave enough rubble in their wake to hide the bodies.

mainBoard.flavorText: The mysterious purpose of two of the rings had eluded Esper mages—until now.

—Agrus Kos

mainBoard.flavorText: After lightning struck the cliffs, the ore became iron, the iron became steel, and the steel became greaves. The lightning never left.
mainBoard.name: Lightning Greaves
mainBoard.originalText:
Equipped creature has haste and shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Equip {0}

rulings.text: If a creature enters the battlefield under your control and gains haste, but then loses it before attacking, it won't be able to attack that turn. This means that you can't use one Lightning Greaves to allow two new creatures to attack in the same turn.

You can't simply unequip Equipment from a creature. If Lightning Greaves is attached to the only creature you control, you won't be able to attach other equipment to it (or target it with anything else) until you have another creature onto which you can move Lightning Greaves.

mainBoard.text:
Equipped creature has haste and shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Equip {0}

mainBoard.flavorText: The form of the sigil is just as important as the sigil itself. If it's carried on a medallion, its bearer is a master. If it's tattooed on the body, its bearer is a slave.
mainBoard.name: Orzhov Signet
mainBoard.originalText: {1}, {T}: Add {W}{B} to your mana pool.

mainBoard.flavorText: Made of bone and boiled in blood, a Rakdos signet is not considered finished until it has been used as a murder weapon.
mainBoard.name: Rakdos Signet
mainBoard.originalText: {1}, {T}: Add {B}{R} to your mana pool.

mainBoard.flavorText: Lost to time is the artificer's art of trapping light from a distant star in a ring of purest gold.
mainBoard.name: Sol Ring
mainBoard.originalText: {T}: Add {C}{C} to your mana pool.
mainBoard.text: {T}: Add {C}{C}.

mainBoard.name: Pyrohemia
mainBoard.originalText:
At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Pyrohemia.
{R}: Pyrohemia deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

rulings.text: Each activation is considered a new damage effect. An activation can only be 1 point of damage.

It will stay on the battlefield if there is a creature that is put into the graveyard during the end step. This is because this ability will not trigger at all if there is at least one creature on the battlefield as the end step begins.
Note that “until end of turn” effects wear off after “at the beginning of the end step” triggered abilities, so an artifact that animates until end of turn can keep this on the battlefield.

mainBoard.text:
At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Pyrohemia.
{R}: Pyrohemia deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Until the world unites in vengeful fury and Phage is destroyed, I will not stay my hand."
—Akroma, angelic avenger
mainBoard.name: Righteous Cause
mainBoard.originalText: Whenever a creature attacks, you gain 1 life.
mainBoard.text: Whenever a creature attacks, you gain 1 life.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Body and spirit are sworn enemies. They will take any excuse to be rid of each other."
—Tariel, Reckoner of Souls
mainBoard.name: Soul Snare
mainBoard.originalText: {W}, Sacrifice Soul Snare: Exile target creature that's attacking you or a planeswalker you control.

rulings.text: If Soul Snare's ability targets a creature that's attacking a planeswalker you control, but that planeswalker is no longer on the battlefield as the ability tries to resolve, the attacking creature will be an illegal target and Soul Snare's ability won't exile that creature.
Sacrificing Soul Snare is part of the cost to activate the ability. Once you activate the ability, no player can do anything to Soul Snare to stop you from activating it.

mainBoard.text: {W}, Sacrifice Soul Snare: Exile target creature that's attacking you or a planeswalker you control.

mainBoard.flavorText: The correct answer to a barbarian's riddle is to choke on your cleverness and die.
mainBoard.name: Stranglehold
mainBoard.originalText:
Your opponents can't search libraries.
If an opponent would begin an extra turn, that player skips that turn instead.

rulings.text: An “extra turn” means a turn created by a spell or ability. It doesn’t refer to a turn taken in a sanctioned tournament after the time limit for the round has expired.
Effects that instruct your opponents to reveal or look at cards from the top of their libraries will still work. Only effects that use the word “search” are affected.
If an effect says “Search your library . . . then shuffle your library,” your opponents shuffle their libraries even though they can’t search.

If an effect says “You may search your library . . . If you do, shuffle your library” or “You may search your library . . . then shuffle your library,” your opponents can’t choose to search, so they won’t shuffle.
If an opponent’s extra turn is created while Stranglehold is on the battlefield, but Stranglehold leaves the battlefield before that turn would begin, that opponent takes the extra turn as normal.

mainBoard.text:
Your opponents can't search libraries.
If an opponent would begin an extra turn, that player skips that turn instead.

mainBoard.flavorText: When defeat is near and guidance is scarce, all eyes look in one direction.
mainBoard.name: Command Tower
mainBoard.originalText: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color in your commander's color identity.

rulings.text: If you don't have a commander, Command Tower's ability produces no mana.
If you have two commanders, the ability adds one mana of any color in their combined color identities.
If your commander is a card that has no colors in its color identity, Command Tower's ability produces no mana. It doesn't produce {C}.

mainBoard.name: Zoetic Cavern
mainBoard.originalText:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
Morph {2} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

rulings.text: If Blood Moon is on the battlefield and a player controls a face-down Zoetic Cavern, it can't be turned face up since it won't have a morph cost.

When Zoetic Cavern is turned face up, any Auras on it that can't legally enchant it will be put into their owners' graveyards. Any Equipment will become unattached and remain on the battlefield. Any counters on it will remain on it.
